Docs.summary: Provides basic functionality for describing the structure of a data source at design time.

remarks.format:
## Remarks Implement the IDataSourceSchema interface to describe a custom data source at design time. For example, the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetSchema>, <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.XmlDocumentSchema>, and <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.TypeSchema> classes implement the IDataSourceSchema interface.
Classes that implement the IDataSourceSchema are used by custom control designer components to provide lists of fields and views for data-bound controls at design time.

Docs.summary: Gets an array of schema descriptors for views contained in the data source.

remarks.format: ## Remarks A class that implements the GetViews method returns an array of objects that implement the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema> interface. For example, in the array returned by the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetSchema.GetViews%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, each element of the array is a <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.DataSetViewSchema> object that implements <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.IDataSourceViewSchema>.
